bibl.title: Letter from Arthur C. Jacobson to Philip Showalter Hench, October 13, 1949

div1.p: Jacobson informs Hench that his article on Reed's residency at Brooklyn Hospital will be released soon. He discusses the illustrations used in the article.

div1.head: Letter from Arthur C. Jacobson to Philip Showalter Hench, October 13, 1949
div1.opener:
ARTHUR C. JACOBSON, M. D.
95 PIERREPONT STREET
BROOKLYN 2, N. Y.
October 13, 1949
Philip S. Hench, M. D.,
102-110 Second Avenue, S. W.,
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Final page proofs are now at the Baltimore printers and
we expect copies before the end of the month.

I am sorry there has been so much delay; I should have
apologized for it before now.

The article will carry a number of illustrations -- the
Brooklyn [City] Hospital as it was in Reed's time; the diplomas; por-
trait of Dr. Joseph C. Hutchison of the staffs of the Kings County Hos-
pital and the Brooklyn City Hospital and also Reed's chief in the Brooklyn
Health Department; and a portrait of Walter Reed as my artist conceives
him to have appeared at age 20 (1871), as a Brooklyn City Hospital intern,
this being an original younger version (also made to appear in a less
serious mood) of a photograph taken in 1874 and enlarged as a basis for
this study.

Incidentally, I have had a second enlargement made of the
aforesaid photograph painted with opaque colors which I think the Brooklyn
Hospital may wish to have for that part of its Archives relating to Reed.

The Hospital will send you the October, 1948 journal with
the address of General Armstrong.

We shall send you six copies of the issue with my article,
or more if you would like to have them.

The article carries an acknowledgement of Mrs. Reed's
courtesy.

Owing to your collaboration I feel that the article has
been well worth while, in that it fills an important hiatus here and
there in the Reed saga.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Arthur C. Jacobson ACJ/h
